title: 2008–09 Syrian Premier League
text:
The 2008–09 Syrian Premier League is the 38th season of the <a href="Syrian%20League">Syrian Premier League</a>, <a href="Syria">Syria</a>'s premier <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> league. The season began on 10 October 2008 and finished on 12 June 2009.
<a href="Afrin%20SC">Afrin</a> and <a href="Al-Horriya">Al-Horriya</a> were relegated from the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20Syrian%20Premier%20League">previous season</a>.
<a href="Al-Wathba">Al-Wathba</a> and <a href="Omayya%20Idlib">Omyyah</a> moved up from the <a href="Syrian%20League%201st%20Division">Syrian League 1st Division</a>.
At the end of the campaign, defending champions <a href="Al-Karamah%20SC">Al-Karamah</a> were level on 52 points with <a href="Al-Ittihad%20Aleppo">Al-Ittihad</a> and therefore were required to have a one off playoff match to determine the league champions.
<a href="Al-Futowa%20Deir%20ez-Zor">Al-Futowa</a> and <a href="Hutteen%20Latakia">Hutteen</a> were relegated and would be replaced by <a href="Afrin%20SC">Afrin</a> and <a href="Al-Jazeera%20Hasakah">Al-Jazeera</a> for the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Syrian%20Premier%20League">2009–10 Syrian Premier League</a> campaign.
Syrian international <a href="Mohamed%20Al%20Zeno">Mohamed Al Zeno</a> finished the campaign as leading goalscorer with 17 goals.
Continental Cups.
AFC Cup.
<a href="Al-Karamah%20SC">Al-Karamah</a> and <a href="Al-Majd%20Damascus">Al-Majd</a> entered the <a href="AFC%20Cup%202009">AFC Cup 2009</a> tournament. A tournament for second ranked Asian nations.
During the domestic Syrian league season, only the group phases of this prestigious tournament is played until the knockout rounds which will take place in the next Syrian season.
<a href="Al-Majd%20Damascus">Al-Majd</a> comfortably qualified with one game to spare to reach the knockout rounds whilst <a href="Al-Karamah%20SC">Al-Karamah</a> had somewhat of a shaky start and after 5 games find themselves in 3rd position.
Arab Champions League.
<a href="Al-Ittihad%20Aleppo">Al-Ittihad</a> and <a href="Al-Taliya">Al-Taliya</a> entered the <a href="Arab%20Champions%20League">Arab Champions League</a> but <a href="Al-Taliya">Al-Taliya</a> found the going tough, being thumped by <a href="Raja%20Casablanca">Raja Casablanca</a> of <a href="Morocco">Morocco</a> in the first round.
<a href="Al-Ittihad%20Aleppo">Al-Ittihad</a> went one round better but got beat by <a href="Wydad%20Casablanca">Wydad Casablanca</a>, also of Morocco.
Final league standings.
Playoffs.
5th and 6th placed teams <a href="Al-Wathba">Al-Wathba</a> and <a href="Al-Majd%20Damascus">Al-Majd</a> had a one match playoff at the end of the season due to both clubs finishing the regular season on 37 points. <a href="Al-Wathba">Al-Wathba</a> won the tie 3–2 to claim 5th position in the final standings.
Championship match.
